node.display_long_description:
Synth Riders is a freestyle dancing VR rhythm alternative. Lose yourself in the incredible music, ride the unique rail system, meet friends in the multiplayer, and get a good workout in the process!

• Dance to 67 Songs - 52 OST and 15 DLC including Muse!
• Enjoy Official Custom Song Support

• Meet up to 10 Friends in Cross-Platform Multiplayer
• Experience a 360° "Spin Mode" in Every Song

• Burn Those Calories with a Fitness Tracker
• Play with Friends and Family in "Party Mode"


The trailer presents the Experience that comes with the "Algorithm" by Muse song. It is a DLC available for $1.99 or as a part of the "Synthwave Essentials 2" Music Pack.


“An amazing physical experience with a workout for the entire body.” -VR Fitness Insider

“Synth Riders offers an excellent, freestyling alternative to other VR rhythm games.” -Android Central

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Introducing minor update with major improvements!

HIGHLIGHTS
- Audio and voice will no longer glitch while loading
- Random song will trigger random stage if enabled
- Everyone will hear song previews in multiplayer

GENERAL IMPROVEMENTS
- With Random Stage selected, using the Random Song button on the song summary screen will now select both a random song & stage.
- (PCVR Only) Notes now have an increased polygon count and note textures no longer have minimaps.

MULTIPLAYER IMPROVEMENTS
- Audio is now muted when starting songs, ending songs and returning to the lobby from the scoreboard to eliminate voice chat stuttering effect.
- All players in a multiplayer room can now hear audio previews or the room's selected song, provided they have the song available to play! Volume is controlled by the in-lobby volume control, and the feature can be disabled in Settings > Multiplayer > Song Audio Preview.

POWER-UPS IMPROVEMENTS
- Power-Ups are clearer when identifying grouped targets - look for the labels "All Leaders", "All Pursuers" as well as "Everyone".
- Power-Ups attack messages are now a little smaller in size.

TWITCH INTEGRATION IMPROVEMENTS (PCVR ONLY)
- You can now connect your Twitch channel in game and have the default Synthriders bot visit you!  If you wish to personalize your bot, you can still do so in the usual way, but now you can also simply enter your channel name in game (Settings > Interface > Twitch Integration) and let our bot come to you.
- Twitch Mods Panel renamed to the Twitch Integration panel, and will not be visible when the game can't connect to Twitch.
- To avoid interaction with other bots (specifically SteamElements), the !set command is now !srset
- When enabled, the twitch help message is now part of the connection message.
- Viewers who change status will now correctly be reflected in cooldowns.

BUG FIXES
- In game news no longer overlaps onboarding in the case that the player launches the game twice before completing onboarding.
- Pausing and resuming on Spin City stage no longer causes the special effect tunnel to occur
- Non-stop play in the Electroswing Essentials DLC fixed.
- Input keyboard no longer stays open when you leave the Playlist edit screen via the close button before closing the keyboard.
- Playing a song with a Custom difficulty and then selecting Random Song on completion could cause the next song to incorrectly load with no notes and finish immediately.
- Fixed Settings > Calibration > PLAY AREA title text.
- Multiplayer: Fixed a condition which could cause players to display 0x multiplier on the Power-Ups summary board.
- Multiplayer: Fixed an issue causing all scores on the leaderboard to incorrectly display as full combo (lightning bolts) on return to the lobby.
- Power-Ups: Players in first place using Embiggen power-up now have a target selected correctly, identified as “All Pursuers”.

As always we welcome your feedback and bug reports on our Official discord server (Invite: http://discord.synthridersvr.com). Please use #bug-report to make sure that we see your feedback.

If you want to support the development of Synth Riders, we really appreciate reviews left on the Oculus Store!

node.display_short_description: With two Muse tracks alongside incredible Synthwave classics, this pack pays tribute to 80s music culture, blending in future influences. Expect catchy tunes, unique voices, and analog synths galore!

nodes.title: You are invited for the "Sunday Sessions" Multiplayer Events!
nodes.body_text:
We invite you for the "Sunday Sessions", a brand new weekly event in the Multiplayer Mode of Synth Riders, Europe-friendly!

Every Sunday at 1PM PST / 10PM CET, join us to enjoy amazing music, dance with friends, meet new people, and get a good workout in the process.

Our host HeyFalcon will jump between the rooms to get the party going.

The legendary "Saturday Synth Fever" is still going to run every Saturday at 6PM!

You can subscribe to both Oculus Events for upcoming weeks to make sure you don't miss the party.

See you in the game!

nodes.title: "Synthwave Essentials 2" feat. Muse is now available!
nodes.body_text:
Enter a neon future!

We are proud to present the “Synthwave Essentials 2” Music Pack featuring 3 free and 5 DLC songs!

Headlined by Muse with tracks from “Simulation Theory” sitting alongside incredible Synthwave classics, this pack pays tribute to 80s music culture, while blending in future influences.

“Algorithm” by Muse comes with a free “Experience”. More than just a stage, this is artistically-driven, immersive visuals that result in the blending of sight, sound, and movement together into a transformative experience.

Check out the trailer of the Muse “Algorithm” Experience

Free songs are already in your library! DLC songs can be purchased for $1.99 or as a bundle with a 20% discount.

You are invited to join our Community on Discord and leave a review on the Oculus Store to support the development.

See you in the game!

node.reviewDescription:
I’m not going to sit here and compare this game to the other rhythm games. I enjoy Beat Saber, just as much as I enjoy Pistol Whip and Audio Trip. I think all these games offer something a little different and I’m happy to switch it up and play them all. 

But there is something about Synth Riders that affects me a little differently. It puts me into almost a zen-like state. It relaxes me to a point even. 

I will go on to add that I found an escape with this game while recently dealing with the loss of my brother. He passed from cancer, months after being diagnosed. It was sudden, and hard to comprehend. Somehow this game allowed me to free my mind and just lose myself in the motions. I don’t know why I react so different to it vs the other games, but I have a special appreciation for it.

website_page_meta.description: Synth Riders is a freestyle dancing VR rhythm alternative. Lose yourself in the incredible music, ride the unique rail system, meet friends in the multiplayer, and get a good workout in the process!
